intro: Viola pseudojaponica f. micrantha, commonly known as the Japanese violet, is a compact perennial herb native to East Asia. It features heart-shaped, dark green leaves with a velvety texture and produces delicate, violet-blue flowers with five petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–20 cm and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and rockeries. The specific form, f. micrantha, is characterized by its smaller, more compact growth and reduced flower size compared to the species.
